sense.definition: indicating the logical subject (that is, the word that would be the subject in an active construction), typically some form of agent (e.g. provided by Joe)
indicating the creator/author of (e.g., plays by Shakespeare)
indicating the MEANS of achieving something (e.g., melt it by cooking it)
indicating a term or name to which some meaning or referent is assigned (e.g., what is meant by 'fair')
indicating the means/medium/route of transport (e.g., travel by car)
indicating the means/criteria/basis of judgment (e.g., judge by looks)
indicating the other parent of someone's/something's child[ren] (e.g., his children by his ex-wife)
indicating the size or amount, as of a margin (e.g., increase by 7%)
as in phrases where something is happening repeatedly or progressively, indicating the unit of time (e.g., month by month)
near; close to in space (e.g., the tree by the house)
near but then past and beyond, as of movement (e.g., drove by the house)
indicating a deadline or the end of a particular time period (e.g., be done by Friday)
indicating the period in which something happens (e.g., 'by day')
according to; concerning (e.g., did well by him)
as used in oaths/swearing (e.g., swore by God)
